content.question: The base of a solid is the region enclosed by the curve <math> <mrow> <mfrac> <mrow> <msup> <mi>x</mi> <mn>4</mn> </msup> </mrow> <mrow> <mn>16</mn> </mrow> </mfrac> <mo>+</mo> <mfrac> <mrow> <msup> <mi>y</mi> <mn>4</mn> </msup> </mrow> <mrow> <mn>81</mn> </mrow> </mfrac> <mo>=</mo> <mn>1</mn> </mrow> </math> shown in the figure above. For the solid, each cross section perpendicular to the x-axis is a semicircle. What is the volume of the solid?

topic.text: 8.8: Volumes with Cross Sections - Triangles and Semicircles

skill.text: Skill 3.D: Apply an appropriate mathematical definition, theorem, or test.
